intro: Polypodium kaieteurum, commonly known as the Kaieteur fern, is a species of polypody found in the tropical regions of South America. It is a terrestrial fern that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive frond structure with a long, narrow rachis and small, clustered pinnae. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its preference for well-drained, humus-rich soil. Polypodium kaieteurum plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
